meanings.definition: A person who buys and sells vintage items.
meanings.sent1: The vints at the flea market had a wide variety of old treasures.
meanings.sent2: I met a friendly vints who specializes in retro clothing.
meanings.sent3: The vints joked that they were a 'vintage detective' hunting for rare finds.
meanings.sent4: She was like a vints sleuth, uncovering hidden gems in thrift stores.
meanings.sent5: The vints' passion for old collectibles was contagious.

meanings.definition: The act of buying or selling vintage items.
meanings.sent1: Her love for vints led her to open a vintage shop.
meanings.sent2: The vints of the antique fair drew in many curious visitors.
meanings.sent3: The vints of the auction house made bidding on old items exciting.
meanings.sent4: The world of vints was like a treasure hunt for unique pieces.
meanings.sent5: The vints' market was bustling with activity and nostalgia.

meanings.definition: To engage in the buying or selling of vintage items.
meanings.sent1: She decided to vints part-time to share her love for old things.
meanings.sent2: People often vints to find rare items for their collections.
meanings.sent3: He would vints on weekends to explore different flea markets.
meanings.sent4: The couple loved to vints together, hunting for vintage decor.
meanings.sent5: They planned to vints at the upcoming vintage fair.
